result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
med list

9:23 AM 
Assistant District Attorney Kurczewski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Robert N Forseth in court for Kyle J Derus.
Defendant Kyle J Derus in court.  
Defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.
Court questions defendant and advises of rights.
Court finds defendant waives his right to a PH, finds probable cause exists, and binds matter over to 1970 for ARGN.
Proceed to ARGN today.
Information to be filed, mirroring complaint.
Waive receipt and reading of information. 
NG plea entered.
Court accepts NG plea.
STC: 9/26/2022 at 10:00am with 1970.
Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
